decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana generation and card draw to power out powerful spells, while also utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring for extra value. The goal is to generate massive amounts of mana with rituals and medallions, then utilize cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Ral, Monsoon Mage to dig for combo pieces. Past in Flames ensures that resources can be reused, while Wish allows for flexibility in finding specific cards. Overall, the deck aims to generate a storm of spells quickly and overwhelm the opponent with sheer speed and power.

The core idea of this deck is to combo off quickly by generating mana with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while also reducing the cost of spells with Ruby Medallion. Ral, Monsoon Mage is used as both a win condition and a way to filter through the deck for key combo pieces. The deck also utilizes Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and has an additional win condition with Wish. The deck aims to storm off and win in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and creatures to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan. It relies on a combination of removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane, along with hand disruption like Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also features powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Necrodominance to close out games. The mana base includes lands that provide flexibility and consistency in casting the spells needed to control the board and emerge victorious.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The key strategy includes using creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters to deal damage quickly, alongside removal spells like Fatal Push and Ob Nixilis, the Adversary to clear the way. Utilizing the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an extra layer of flexibility and consistency to the deck. Overall, the goal is to maintain early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and finish the game swiftly.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the UrzaTron lands to produce large amounts of mana quickly. By doing so, the deck aims to play big threats like Emrakul, the World Anew and Karn, the Great Creator to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also incorporates powerful artifacts like The One Ring and The Underworld Cookbook to further enhance its control capabilities. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish a strong mana base and use it to play game-changing threats and control the game.
